articles.description: Check out the full numbers for two of the biggest gaming companies in the world--hint: it's a lot.
articles.content:
Two of the biggest gaming publishers in the business, Activision Blizzard and Electronic Arts, have shared new numbers about how much money their games make from microtransactions--and it's a lot.

articles.title: Forza Street is free to play on your phone right now - CNET
articles.description: It's the first time a Forza game has launched on a platform not owned by Microsoft.
articles.content:
Gentlemen and ladies, start your engines.
Microsoft
Forza is one of gaming's most acclaimed racing franchises, and now you can play it on your phone. Kind of. Forza Street, a free-to-play street racing game that looks more like Need for Speed than the Forza… [+1040 chars]

articles.author: Rachel Kaser
articles.title: Check out this Super Mario 64 PC port before Nintendo's lawyers pounce - The Next Web
articles.description: A fan has made a PC port of Super Mario 64 with 4K graphics. It's beautiful -- now let's see how long it lasts before Nintendo kills it.
articles.content:
A Mario fan has made a lovely, functional port of the Nintendo 64 classic for PC, with 4K graphics and ray-tracing, the whole enchilada. Everyone come take a look before Nintendos lawyers strip it clean like piranhas on a dead cow.
The video depicting the po… [+2281 chars]

articles.author: Alessandro Barbosa
articles.title: Call Of Duty: Modern Warfare's File Size Is Getting Ridiculous - GameSpot
articles.description: With another large update last week, Call of Duty: Modern Warfare's file size is approaching half that of standard console hard drives.
articles.content: Since launch, Call of Duty: Modern Warfare has been steadily growing in size thanks to its frequent, large updates. Following last week's latest patch and additional DLC content, the Modern Warfare file size now occupies close to 200GB on any given platform, … [+2308 chars]

articles.author: Charlie Hall
articles.title: There’s a Skate 3 mobile game in the works at EA, according to pro skater - Polygon
articles.description: The Skate series is back in the news. Now pro skater Jason Dill says he was approached last summer to appear in the game. The news follows rumors that EA might have abandoned the Skate trademark altogether.
articles.content:
At least one former professional skateboarder says hes been approached about a new video game in the Skate series. Jason Dill leaked the information during a recent episode of the podcast The Nine Club, which was first reported by Wccftech.
